title: Album Page, "Bridge Between Two Buildings, Blois", ca. 1889
medium: Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 78; lower right corner: Blois / 66; to left of drawing: Roof and sides are of slate / The span is 12 ft / height to corbel 8 ft and / from there to beam 2 ft 6 in -.
description: Vertical sheet depicting a view into an alley where a larger and smaller figure stand at the far end.  Above them is an enclosed, windowed bridge between the façade of the building on the left, and the building on the right.  There are small planted window boxes on the bridge, and it is supported by long timbers from below.  The façade of the building on the right has a slight projection at the second story. The walls of this room rests on floor joists that project out from the building façade.  Verso contains small sketch of a square with a long line projecting from one parallel side.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Bridge Between Two Buildings, Blois", ca. 1889.Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-239.
